metadata.title: CVE-2018-13440 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The audiofile Audio File Library 0.3.6 has a NULL pointer dereference bug in ModuleState::setup in modules/ModuleState.cpp, which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted caf file, as demonstrated by sfconvert.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-13440` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

audiofile-tools - 0.3.6-5
libaudiofile1 - 0.3.6-5
No subscription required

notes.note: ebarretto> It looks like upstream is not active anymore, some of the open CVEs have a proposed fix on a fork. Marking as deferred for now.

criterions.comment: audiofile package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.6-5').
